page.title: 05A FARMER'S LIFESTYLE, RANBY
page.content: The farmer has been in business near Ranby for thirty years.The farm which had been previously tenanted was bought from the Newcastle Estate. Every day,after an early swim the farmer makes essential telephone calls until 8:00am. These days he spends about two-thirds of his time in the office, managing the farm. Because of a slipped disc and the size of the farm he has to employ a secretary to help run the farm. Though consious of the need to operate profitably, for personal preference, he avoids intensive farming methods except for rearing piglets in farrowing sheds, where they are kept with their mothers until weaned for the first 3 to 4 weeks. He is very interested in wild life and makes considerable efforts to preserve it.
